alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:29PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water Levels Along the Yukon River Into the Weekend... Water levels on the Yukon River will continue to rise and reach bankfull and likely go overbank in low lying areas over the next few days. A large ice jam upriver from Ruby released on Sunday and this surge of water is currently moving down the Yukon River. Some low lying fish camps or remote cabins along the river could be impacted. At this time, flooding is not expected in Grayling, Anvik, or Holy Cross but residents should be prepared for high water by moving items away from the river. The NWS will continue to monitor this situation and provide updates if conditions change. At Russian Mission, an ice jam is causing significant flooding in the community. See the Flood Warning for Russian Mission for more details.
